questions.text: Most definitive sign of pregnancy is :
Content of iron and folic acid in IFA tab distributed by government of India are:

options.label: A
options.text: 60mg of elemental iron and 500 micrograms of folic acid

options.label: B
options.text: 100 mg of elemental iron and 500 micrograms of folic acid

options.label: C
options.text: 120 mg of elemental iron and 750 micrograms of folic acid

options.label: D
options.text: 200 mg of elemental iron and 1000 micrograms of folic acid

questions.correct_answer: A. 60mg of elemental iron and 500 micrograms of folic acid

questions.text: A 37 weeks pregnant woman attends an antenatal clinic at a Primary Health Centre. She has not had any antenatal care till now. The best approach regarding tetanus immunization to this case would be to:

options.label: A
options.text: Give a dose to Tetanus Toxoid (TT) and explain to her that is will not protect the new born and she should take the second dose after four weeks even if she delivers in the meantime

options.label: B
options.text: Do not waste the TT vaccine as it would anyhow be of no use in this pregnancy

options.label: C
options.text: Given one dose of TT and explain that it will not be useful for this pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: Give her anti-tetanus Immuno-globulin along with the TT vaccine

questions.correct_answer: A. Give a dose to Tetanus Toxoid (TT) and explain to her that is will not protect the new born and she should take the second dose after four weeks even if she delivers in the meantime
questions.explanation:
Explanation:

  • • Incorrect Options:
  • • Option B (Do not waste the TT vaccine as it would anyhow be of no use in this pregnancy) Explanation: This is incorrect because even a single dose provides maternal protection and initiates the development of antibodies that can be transferred to the fetus, albeit possibly not to the optimal protective level for neonatal tetanus prevention if delivery is very soon. It is never a waste to provide beneficial vaccination.
  • • Option C (Given one dose of TT and explain that it will not be useful for this pregnancy) Explanation: Similar to option B, this is incorrect. The vaccine is useful for the mother's protection. While the full benefit for neonatal tetanus requires a completed series and sufficient time before delivery, it's misleading and discouraging to state it will be "not useful" for this pregnancy entirely, as some antibody transfer may occur.
  • • Option D (Give her anti-tetanus Immuno-globulin along with the TT vaccine) Explanation: Anti-tetanus Immunoglobulin (TIG) provides immediate, but temporary, passive immunity and is typically reserved for high-risk tetanus-prone wounds. It is not part of the routine antenatal immunization schedule for preventing neonatal tetanus. While TIG is given alongside TT for acute wound management, it is not the standard approach for a routine antenatal visit aiming to establish active immunity for the mother and passive immunity for the newborn

questions.text: Daily dietry calcium required in 3rd trimester of pregnancy :
Ureteric dilatation in pregnancy is due to :
Implantation bleeding :

A mother comes with history of antenatal fetal death due to neural tube defect in first child. What is the amount of folic acid you will prescribe during preconceptional counselling (in micrograms/day)?
Hegar’s sign of pregnancy is:
An expectant mother feels quickening at:
Folic acid supplementation reduces the risk of:
Which is not a feature of pseudocyesis:
questions.correct_answer: C. Fetal heart sounds are audible

questions.text: Term delivery implies that the gestational age of the foetus calculated from the time of onset of last menstrual period is:

A 44-year-old G6P3215 presents for her well-woman examination. She tells you that all of her deliveries were vaginal and that her largest child weighed 2900 g at birth. How many full-term pregnancies did this patient have?

A patient comes to your office with her last menstrual period 4 weeks ago. She denies any symptoms such as nausea, fatigue, urinary frequency, or breast tenderness. She thinks that she may be pregnant because she has not had her period yet. She is very anxious to find out because she has a history of a previous ectopic pregnancy and wants to be sure to get early prenatal care. Which of the following actions is most appropriate at this time?

options.label: A
options.text: No action is needed because the patient is asymptomatic, has not missed her period, and cannot be pregnant.

options.label: B
options.text: Order a serum quantitative pregnancy test

options.label: C
options.text: Listen for fetal heart tones by Doppler equipment

options.label: E
options.text: Perform a bimanual pelvic examination to assess uterine size

questions.correct_answer: B. Order a serum quantitative pregnancy test

questions.text: Which of the following describes the reproductive history of a pregnant woman who is 32 weeks pregnant with a previous twin delivery and a still birth at 32 weeks
Which of the following is true regarding hCG in your patient?

options.label: A
options.text: The corpus luteum produces hCG throughout pregnancy

options.label: B
options.text: It is composed of two dissimilar alpha and Beta units

options.label: C
options.text: Levels double every 3 to 4 days in early pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: Levels peak after 24 weeks of pregnancy T

questions.correct_answer: B. It is composed of two dissimilar alpha and Beta units

questions.text: A 28-year-old woman presents to the emergency department with abdominal pain since the past day. She reports a 1-week history of nausea with occasional vomiting. She denies vaginal bleeding. She reports that her last period was 4 weeks ago. BP is 117/68, pulse rate of 78 beats per minute.. She notes some suprapubic abdominal discomfort with palpation, but she does not have rebound tenderness or guarding. A speculum examination reveals a closed cervix without bleeding. A pelvic examination reveals a normally sized, anteverted uterus, and palpably normal adnexa. A urine pregnancy test is positive. What is the test you should order first?

A 22-year-old woman, gravida 1, para 0, at 15 weeks of gestation by her LMP, presents to you for an ultrasound examination to confi rm her due date. Which of the following measurements on the fetus is the best at predicting her actual due date?
A woman not currently pregnant who has had one previous termination, one early miscarriage and one still birth at 36 weeks. For this description choose the most appropriate answer
Match the column of hormones to their effects in pregnancy
Match the columns of indication with the relevant vaccination in pregnancy

A patient presents for her first initial prenatal visit after having a positive home pregnancy test. She reports a last menstrual period of about 8 weeks ago. She says she is not entirely sure of her dates, however, because she has a long history of irregular menses. Her urine pregnancy test in your office is positive. Which of the following is the most accurate way of dating this patient’s pregnancy?

options.label: A
options.text: Determination of uterine size on pelvic examination

options.label: B
options.text: Quantitative serum human chorionic gonadotropin (HCG) level

options.label: C
options.text: Crown-rump length on abdominal or vaginal ultrasound

options.label: D
options.text: Determination of progesterone level along with serum HCG level

questions.correct_answer: C. Crown-rump length on abdominal or vaginal ultrasound

questions.text: An 18-year-old G1 at 8 weeks gestation complains of nausea and vomiting over the past week occurring on a daily basis. Nausea and emesis are a common symptom in early pregnancy. Which of the following signs or symptoms would indicate a more serious diagnosis of hyperemesis gravidarum?
Which is not correctly paired
